IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE HIGHER EDUCATION FOR APPROXIMATELY 1,500 STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY PROVIDING STUDENT FOCUSED BACCALAUREATE AND GRADUATE EDUCATION IN THE SPIRIT OF THE SISTERS OF MERCY. WELCOMES WOMEN AND MEN OF ALL BELIEFS TO JOIN THE COMMUNITY IN PURSUIT OF EDUCATION AND SERVICE TO THOSE IN NEED. PROMOTES REFLECTIVE JUDGMENT, STRATEGIC COMMUNICATION, THE COMMON GOOD AND PURPOSEFUL LIVING THROUGH A CORE CURRICULUM, LIBERAL ARTS AND PROFESSIONAL MAJORS AND STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. STRIVE FOR EXCELLENCE IN ACCOMPLISHING OUR MISSION THROUGH FOUR INTERDEPENDENT GOALS: USING REFLECTIVE JUDGMENT, ENGAGING IN STRATEGIC COMMUNICATION, SERVING THE COMMON GOOD AND PROMOTING PURPOSEFUL LIVING.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION: PROVIDE GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE HIGHER EDUCATION IN PROGRAMS INCLUDING TRADITIONAL DAYTIME FORMAT, NON TRADITIONAL EVENING FORMAT, ONLINE, AND ACCELERATED EVENING AND WEEKEND FORMAT. DEGREES GRANTED INCLUDE MFT, MSN, MBA, MSL, MA IN EDUCATION, MM, DMFT, AND DNP (GRADUATE PROGRAMS) AND BA, BS, BAS, BSN AND BBA (UNDERGRADUATE PROGRAMS). FOR FALL OF 2022, THERE WERE 1,081 TRADITIONAL, 83 ACCELERATED AND 157 GRADUATE, 107 ONLINE, AND 98 ONLINE GRADUATE STUDENTS. TOTAL UNDERGRADUATE FTE WAS 1,141; GRADUATE FTE WAS 219.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY SERVICES: PROVIDE RESIDENCE HALLS WITH CAPACITY OF 450 STUDENTS, MEALS (BOARD PLANS) FOR RESIDENTIAL AND NON-RESIDENTIAL STUDENTS AND BOOKSTORE FOR TEXTBOOK PURCHASES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ACADEMIC SUPPORT: PROVIDE ACADEMIC RESOURCES TO ALL STUDENTS INCLUDING LIBRARY SERVICES, COMPUTER CENTER AND LABS, ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE AND CAMPUS MINISTRIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: STUDENT SERVICES: ATHLETICS, HEALTH SERVICES, ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MOUNT MERCY HOLDS SEVERAL PIECES OF ARTWORK THAT ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC DISPLAY AT ITS JANALYN HANSON WHITE ART GALLERY AND ITS STUDENT-SUPPORTED PAHA REVIEW ART PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY, THESE WORKS GENERALLY SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S COMPREHENSIVE UNDERGRADUATE ART PROGRAM.

THE UNIVERSITY IS RECONGIZED AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE UNIVERSITY MAY BE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON ANY NET INCOME FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THE UNIVERSITY FILES A FORM 990 (RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX) ANNUALLY AND UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME (UBI) IS REPORTED ON FORM 990-T, AS APPROPRIATE. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR MATERIAL TAX POSITIONS, WHICH INCLUDE SUCH MATTERS AS THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS AND VARIOUS POSITIONS RELATIVE TO POTENTIAL SOURCES OF UBI. AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

MOUNT MERCY UNIVERSITY RECEIVES FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID AND GRANTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED A MINIMUM OF ONCE EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH QUESTIONS REGARDING THE INTENT AND/OR INTERPRETATION OF THESE STANDARDS. COMPLETION RATE AND GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) REQUIREMENTS FULL-TIME STUDENTS (STUDENTS ATTEMPTING 12 OR MORE CREDIT HOURS EACH SEMESTER) MUST PROGRESS ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE: MINIMUM CREDITS MINIMUM REQUIRED COMPLETED CUMULATIVE GPA YEAR 1 24 2.00 YEAR 2 48 2.00 YEAR 3 72 2.00 YEAR 4 96 2.00 YEAR 5 123 2.00 THESE CREDIT HOURS MUST BE EARNED DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR (FALL, WINTER AND SPRING). HOWEVER, IF A STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THESE REQUIRED HOURS, THEY MAY BE EARNED DURING THE FOLLOWING SUMMER SESSION(S). FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD BY THE END OF THE SUMMER WILL RESULT IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE COMPLETED CUMULATIVE HOURS MEET THE MINIMUM STANDARDS. LOSS OF AID IS NOT THE SAME AS ACADEMIC SUSPENSION, WHICH IS HANDLED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. PART-TIME STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ONE-HALF OF THE CREDIT HOURS THEY ATTEMPT. COMBINED STUDENTS (STUDENTS BLENDING TERMS OF FULL- AND PART-TIME ENROLLMENT) MUST ACHIEVE A CUMULATIVE TOTAL THAT SATISFIES THE COMBINED FULL- AND PART-TIME STANDARDS. STUDENTS WHO DO NOT ACHIEVE THE MINIMUM CUMULATIVE GPA ARE GRANTED ONE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER IN WHICH TO RAISE THEIR CUMULATIVE GPA TO THE MINIMUM. FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD AT ANY POINT FOLLOWING THE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER RESULTS IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE CUMULATIVE GPA MEETS THE MINIMUM STANDARDS.

AWARD LETTERS ARE ISSUED TO PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS WITH THE ELIGIBLE INSTITUTIONAL AID IN ADDITION TO OTHER KNOWN STATE/FEDERAL/OTHER GRANTS PRIOR TO STUDENTS ATTENDING MOUNT MERCY. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS PROVIDED IS BASED ON ACTUAL AWARDED FINANCIAL AID INCLUDING INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS/DISCOUNTS.

PRESIDENT IS AUTHORIZED PER CONTRACT TO HAVE SPOUSE ACCOMPANY HIM TO EVENTS, BUT NO SPOUSE TRAVEL OCCURRED IN FISCAL YEAR 2022-23. THE PRESIDENT LIVED IN UNIVERSITY PAID HOUSING, NOW OWNS HIS OWN HOME (PURCHASED AUGUST 2022) AND DOES NOT RECEIVE A HOUSING ALLOWANCE. THE PRESIDENT AND VP FOR DEVELOPMENT HAVE COUNTRY CLUB MEMBERSHIPS PAID FOR BY THE UNIVERSITY AS PART OF HIS REGULAR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES. THESE BENEFITS WERE NOT INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
THE PRESIDENT RECEIVED A PERFORMANCE BONUS OF $30,000 PER HIS EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT IN CALENDAR YEAR 2022.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCED EXISTING DEBT - SEE BOND DOCUMENTS UPLOADED BELOW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE M, COLUMN (B): NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS
TOTAL NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS IS 330. VOLUNTEERS CONSIST OF BOARD MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS FOR PHONATHON, AND VOLUNTEER COACHES FOR EM, DEVELOPMENT AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ARE ON THE GOVERNING BOARD. IT SHALL ALSO BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO ANNUALLY EVALUATE THE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT AND TO ADVISE THE PRESIDENT ACCORDINGLY IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PRESIDENT'S RESPONSIBILITIES. AMONG ITS RESPONSIBILITIES ARE RECOMMENDING THE ANNUAL SALARY, BENEFITS, AND RELATED MATTERS TO BE ACCORDED TO THE PRESIDENT AND MEMBERS OF THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. IT IS ALSO THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THIS COMMITTEE TO ESTABLISH THE PROCESS FOR PRESIDENTIAL SEARCHES. AT LEAST ONCE EVERY FIVE (5) TO TEN (10) YEAR PERIOD OF PRESIDENTIAL INCUMBENCY, IF THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE PREPARED TO RENEW A LONG-TERM COMMITMENT TO EACH OTHER, THE PRESIDENT AND THE BOARD SHALL PARTICIPATE IN A COMPREHENSIVE JOINT REVIEW PROCESS TO BE CONDUCTED AS THE BOARD SHALL THEN DETERMINE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BARBARA KNAPP, BOARD TRUSTEE AND JIM NIKRANT, BOARD TRUSTEE HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE & EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 PRIOR TO IT BEING FILED AND VOTES TO ACCEPT IT. EACH BOARD MEMBER RECEIVES A COPY OF THE COMPLETED 990 PRIOR TO THE RETURN BEING FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS OF THE INSTITUTION ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ALL RELATIONSHIPS AND BUSINESS AFFILIATIONS THAT REASONABLY COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST INVOLVING THE INSTITUTION ANNUALLY USING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE. ALL DISCLOSURES REQUIRED UNDER THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY MUST BE DIRECTED IN WRITING TO THE SECRETARY OF THE BOARD WHO, TOGETHER WITH THE UNIVERSITY COUNSEL, SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIS POLICY. MATTERS UNDER THIS POLICY CONCERNING TRUSTEES SHALL BE REPORTED INITIALLY TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD FOR APPROPRIATE ACTION; THOSE CONCERNING STAFF WILL BE REFERRED INITIALLY TO THE PRESIDENT. INFORMATION DISCLOSED TO THE SECRETARY OR PRESIDENT SHALL BE HELD IN CONFIDENCE EXCEPT WHEN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE INSTITUTION WOULD BE SERVED BY DISCLOSING THE INFORMATION TO THE BOARD IN EXECUTIVE SESSION. TRUSTEES OR OFFICERS WHO HAVE DECLARED OR BEEN FOUND TO HAVE CONFLICT OF INTEREST IN ANY MATTER BEFORE THE ADMINISTRATION OR THE BOARD SHALL REFRAIN FROM PARTICIPATING IN CONSIDERATION OF THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION, UNLESS FOR SPECIAL REASONS THE BOARD OR ADMINISTRATION REQUESTS INFORMATION OR INTERPRETATION FROM THE PERSON OR PERSONS INVOLVED. THE PERSON OR PERSONS INVOLVED SHOULD NOT VOTE ON SUCH MATTERS AND SHOULD NOT BE PRESENT AT THE TIME OF VOTE. THE ORGANIZATION DOCUMENTS ITS PROCEEDINGS AND FINDINGS IN ITS MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES EACH YEAR REVIEWS THE SALARY AND BENEFITS OF THE PRESIDENT. THROUGH THE ANNUAL BUDGET REVIEW PROCESS, THE SALARIES OF OTHER OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES ARE RESEARCHED AND COMPARED WITH THE SALARIES AT MOUNT MERCY IN ORDER TO DETERMINE REASONABLENESS AND COMPETITIVENESS. MOUNT MERCY ENGAGES A THIRD PARTY FIRM WHICH USES INDUSTRY DATA TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION. SEE SCHEDULE J, PART III. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE EITHER APPROVES THE BUDGET OR MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ADJUSTMENTS BASED UPON THE COMPARATIVE DATA SUPPLIED. ALL COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTED. THE PROCESS DESCRIBED HERE WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2023

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
